title: CLASP Basics - Friendly Guide
summary: A readable walkthrough for the foundational clasp commands: set up, sync, deploy, and check status without surprises.
mentalModel: Treat clasp like Git for Apps Script: you authenticate once, connect a local folder to a remote script, then push/pull changes and create deployments for users.

sections.title: Core ideas
content: Authenticate once per machine, then clasp stores tokens in ~/.clasprc.json.
Each project has a .clasp.json with the remote scriptId; keep it in version control.
Push uploads local files; pull downloads the cloud version; deploy creates shareable URLs.

sections.title: First-time setup
content: 2) Authenticate: clasp login (use --no-localhost on locked-down networks)
3) Clone existing: clasp clone-script <scriptId> OR create new: clasp create-script --title "My App"

sections.title: Daily workflow
content: Edit locally in your IDE, run clasp push to sync to the Apps Script editor.
If anyone edits in the web editor, run clasp pull before pushing to avoid conflicts.
Check status before pushing: clasp show-file-status or git status for your repo.

commonWorkflows.name: Sync changes safely
steps: clasp pull   # grab any cloud edits first
clasp push   # upload your local changes
clasp open-script # quick sanity check in the web editor
tips: If someone edited online after your last pull, resolve locally before force pushing.
Use --force only when you are sure your local copy should win.

commonWorkflows.name: Create a deployment URL
steps: clasp open-web-app   # open the live URL
tips: Use new versions for releases; avoid @HEAD for anything user-facing.
Keep deployment IDs noted in README or release notes.

memoryHooks: Push up, pull down: push uploads local to cloud; pull downloads cloud to local.
Deploy is not push: push updates the editor, deploy creates URLs for users.
Login once per machine; logout only when switching accounts or securing shared devices.

examples.title: Start a clean project bound to Sheets
examples.explanation: Creates a container-bound script and opens the parent Sheet to test menu items or functions.

examples.title: Work on an existing script with a teammate
examples.explanation: Clone once, then always pull before push to avoid overwriting their online edits.

troubleshooting: Offline/auth errors on corporate networks: clasp login --no-localhost to bypass blocked callbacks.
Push conflicts: pull first, merge locally, then push; avoid --force unless necessary.
Wrong account: clasp show-authorized-user to verify, clasp logout to switch.
recap: Authenticate, connect a folder, push/pull like Git.
Deploy to create URLs; push alone does not publish.
Pull before push when collaborating to avoid overwrites.
